title: Climbing Mount Salbarii
atmosphere: Increasingly harsh as altitude rises. Thin atmosphere, cold, rocky terrain. The mountain looms above, crater invisible from below. Physical challenge intensifies with each stage.
description: Multi-stage climb from 500m to 1400m altitude to reach the crater where Highndry is parked. Physical endurance and skill testing throughout.
duration: Several hours to full day depending on pace and conditions

triggers.entry: Travellers depart from vehicle at 500m altitude

stages.name: Lower Slopes
stages.description: Steep slope with frequent detours around rock faces. Option for shortcut climb.

stages.name: Middle Ascent
stages.description: Altitude effects begin. Fast pace risks sickness.

stages.name: Upper Slopes
stages.description: Steep, rocky terrain. Altitude effects worsen.

stages.name: Scramble Zone
stages.description: Hazardous scrambling over loose rock. Risk of falls.

stages.name: Final Ascent
stages.description: Almost sheer rock face to crater lip.

stages.name: Crater Descent
stages.description: Climb down into crater where Highndry waits.

altitude_sickness.moderate: DM-4 on all checks, nausea, headache, mental numbness
altitude_sickness.severe: DM-6 on all checks, incapacitation risk

narrator_prompt: Mount Salbarii tests the Travellers physically and mentally. Each stage is harder than the last. The thin atmosphere saps strength, the cold numbs fingers, the loose rock threatens falls. But somewhere up there, in the crater, their ship is waiting.
